key_title: Key to the species of Leptorhynchos

source.author: Flann, C.
source.title: Leptorhynchos
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Flann, C. (1999). Leptorhynchos. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Margins of involucral bracts entire (apices sometimes minutely dentate, fimbriate or laciniate), never ciliate or cottony
Margins of involucral bracts ciliate (sometimes shortly) or cottony
Leaves elliptic-oblanceolate, 1–7 cm long, 1–6 mm wide, indumentum of septate hirsute hairs, involucral bracts ovate or elliptic
Leaves linear, 1–4 cm long, 1–4 mm wide, indumentum of appressed arachnoid hairs, involucral bracts ovate to orbicular
Cypselas gradually tapering to obscure beak, or not beaked, papillose at least near apex
Cypselas rather abruptly tapered to distinct slender beak about as long as body, scabrous, but at least upper part of beak smooth
Involucral bract surfaces smooth; inner involucral bracts without a hyaline apiculum or if present then short (to 0.5 mm long)
Involucral bract surfaces minutely scabridulous; inner involucral bracts with a hyaline apiculum c. 2 mm long
Flowering stem leafless in upper 2–20 cm, sometimes with scarious or partially scarious bracts (but these strongly differentiated from leaves)
Flowering stem leafy to within 2 cm of capitula, sometimes with scarious or partially scarious bracts (these grading to leaves but of similar form)
Pappus bristles of bisexual floret fewer than 8
Pappus bristles of bisexual florets more than 8
Perennial; pappus bristles of bisexual florets 4–7; cypsela smooth
Annual; pappus bristles of bisexual florets 4 (rarely 5); cypsela papillose to minutely scabrous
